title_sort: joseph c. baldwin to walt whitman, 11 september 1877
title: Joseph C. Baldwin to Walt Whitman, 11 September 1877
text: Elliottstown, Illinois,September 11, 1877Dear WaltI am well now But I Have just got out of a bed of sickness. I Have Had the Intermiten[intermittent] fever and pretty Bad.Walt a friend in need is a friend indeed. I will ask you wanst[once] more to Help me a little if you could lend me ten Dollars for a short time say six weeks or two months until I can sell som[some] corn. I will Have about 2000 Buishels[bushels] But it wont be ripe for six weeks or two months and then I will send it Back to you with may[many] thanks after I get things fixt[fixed] up then I think I will pay you a visit and we will enjoy ourslves[ourselves] as of oldwrite just as soon as you get this,yours truly,Joseph C. Baldwin Joseph C. Baldwin to Walt Whitman, 11 September 1877
